meanings.definition: Of or relating to the outermost region of a planet's atmosphere.
meanings.sent1: The exospheric layer is very far from the surface of the planet.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the exospheric conditions to understand space better.
meanings.sent3: The exospheric winds play hide-and-seek with the spacecraft.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts floated in an exospheric realm, detached from reality.
meanings.sent5: The exospheric glow at sunset painted the sky in hues of pink and orange.

meanings.definition: Located or occurring in the exosphere.
meanings.sent1: The exospheric satellites orbit high above the Earth.
meanings.sent2: Astronauts experience exospheric conditions during spacewalks.
meanings.sent3: The exospheric birds soared effortlessly in the thin air.
meanings.sent4: His dreams reached an exospheric height, beyond imagination.
meanings.sent5: The exospheric view from the spaceship was breathtaking, with Earth below like a tiny ball.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the highest layer of the Earth's atmosphere.
meanings.sent1: The exospheric layer shields the Earth from harmful solar radiation.
meanings.sent2: Meteoroids burn up in the exospheric heat during entry.
meanings.sent3: The exospheric clouds drifted lazily in the upper atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed in an exospheric silence, filling the room.
meanings.sent5: The exospheric boundary marks the edge of our planet's protective shield.
